title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 459.9 - Specific validation procedures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 459.9 - Specific validation procedures

State Regulations
(a) Every participant coming into the senior
center on the specified date will sign the daily log. A visitor who is not a
bona fide member shall sign a guest log and not be included in the
sample. (b) Their names will then
be checked against the participant record files, which will provide the basis
for verifying that they are at least 60 years of age, or the spouse of a person
at least 60 years of age. (c) After
a brief explanation of why the requested information is being obtained, including the statement that the provision of this information is optional on
the part of the participant, the individual will be asked to show any
documentation which would identify him as being categorically related, such as
a Medicaid card, P.A. ID card, SSI award letter. This information is to be
recorded on the validation form for categorically related individuals, and such
identification will terminate the validation process for those individuals of
the sample group. (d) Those
participants who do not have any of the above documentation or indicate that
they are not categorically related would be asked to voluntarily sign a group
declaration form that states that their "monthly gross income is less than 90
percent of the then in effect State median income, adjusted for family size,"
or if they prefer, an individual declaration form that certifies the same
facts. (The actual figures of the State median income adjusted for family size
will be published in the current Comprehensive Annual Social Services Program

Plan for New York State.) All those participants who signed either the
individual or group declaration are then finished with the validation
process. (e) The number in the
sample who are categorically related (see subdivision [c] of this section) will
be added to the number who sign the group or individual forms (see subdivision
[d] of this section) certifying that their income is below the required
level. (f) Every person not
validated by the previous steps must be listed on another form "Individuals Not

Validated." This includes anyone who refuses or otherwise fails to participate
in the validation process after signing the log, as well as anyone who declare
income above the cutoff level. The residue of the sample who fail to show
documentation or sign the group or individual declarations as to their level of
income, will be run against existing M.A. or P.A. files when determined
appropriate to comply with Federal requirements. (g) The total number of persons recorded on
the categorical, group and individual declaration and not validated forms must
equal the number in the sample, as listed on the daily log. This reconciliation
is to be recorded on the return transmittal form prescribed by the
department. (h) The completed forms
from each center in the sample, including the daily log, are to be packed with
the return transmittal form and returned to the main office of the local social
services district conducting the validation. Notes
